newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish Sept yr/yr CPI up 2.5 pct (EU method).
newsitem.headline: Danish Sept yr/yr CPI up 2.5 pct (EU method).

text.p: Danish consumer prices rose 0.7 per cent in September from August and were 2.5 percent higher than in September 1995, the National Statistics Office said on Monday.

The CPI data was issued under new EU-harmonised calculation methods. Under the traditional Danish national formula the respective figures would have risen 0.5 percent month-on-month and 2.3 percent year-on-year.
NEW EU FORMULA Sept 1996 August 1996 Sept 1995
NOTE - Average analyst expectations were for a 2.3 percent rise from September 1995 according to the national formula. -- Steve Weizman, Copenhagen Newsroom +45-33-969650
